docs.lead_paragraph: Opinions on President Obama’s plan to expand background checks run the gamut in the city, but many residents seem to agree that it will do little to stop mass shootings.

headline.main: To San Bernardino, Obama’s Gun Plan Goes Too Far or Falls Short
headline.print_headline: Skepticism Prevails in San Bernardino After President’s Announcement

docs.abstract: Many residents of San Bernardino, Calif, say Pres Obama's plan to expand background checks and law enforcement for some gun sales would not do much to stop mass shootings like December assault that killed 14 people in their city.
docs.snippet: Opinions on President Obama’s plan to expand background checks run the gamut in the city, but many residents seem to agree that it will do little to stop mass shootings.

docs.lead_paragraph: Expensive premiums and high deductibles for policies sold under the Affordable Care Act make tax penalties the preferred option for some resisters.

headline.main: Many See I.R.S. Penalties as More Affordable Than Insurance
headline.print_headline: Many Holdouts Roll the Dice and Pay I.R.S., Not an Insurer

docs.abstract: Many of over 10 million Americans who are eligible to buy health insurance through Affordable Care Act's insurance exchanges have yet to make commitment, believing it cheaper to pay government fine than to pay for coverage; while number of uninsured has continued to drop, which suggests threat of fine has been sufficient for some, healthy number of holdouts underscores concerns in insurance industry over financial viability of exchanges over time.
docs.snippet: Expensive premiums and high deductibles for policies sold under the Affordable Care Act make tax penalties the preferred option for some resisters.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: While consensus holds that there is little to no evidence linking cellphone use to an increased risk of health problems, scientists and health agencies disagree about what guidance to give the public.

headline.main: At C.D.C., a Debate Behind Recommendations on Cellphone Risk
headline.print_headline: At C.D.C., Evolution of Advice on Phones

docs.snippet: While consensus holds that there is little to no evidence linking cellphone use to an increased risk of health problems, scientists and health agencies disagree about what guidance to give the public.
